description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7nghp","text":"This protocol details collection of fiber photometry from VTA dopamine neurons.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"61ujq","text":"Recordings collected with a Tucker-Davis Technologies RZ10X and TDT Synapse software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

parent_collections.title: "Reward perseveration is shaped by GABAA-mediated dopamine pauses", Burwell et al

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c36lb","text":"Photobleach the mono fiberoptic patchcords (Doric Lenses Inc., MFP_400/430/1100-0.57_1mm_FCM-MF1.25_LAF) (Synapse -\u003e Preview Mode -\u003e Fiber Bleaching) for at least  , and up to  , in both the 415nm and 465nm channels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":163,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":176,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3il42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi6u6","text":"This can be done the night before to save time during experimental hours ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":14400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9a67","text":"Use a BNC cable to connect the solenoid output circuitry (see Behavior Hardware Setup protocol) and a ground connection to one of the RZ10x BNC ports. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b02o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40a8i","text":"Use a User Input Gizmo to record input from the correct BNC port","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k7vh","text":"This will mean that, whenever the solenoid gets a +5V signal to open from the behavior MATLAB code, the RZ10X will also record an analog +1 signal. This enables later alignment of the fiber photometry recordings with the behavior data for analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3f0qi","text":"Use the PM1 power meter (Preview Mode -\u003e Power Meter) to check and adjust, as necessary, the LED parameters: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ffle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6smq","text":"The 415nm LED level should be at an amperage that produces a 20ÂµW reading","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duggi","text":"The 465nm LED level should be at an amperage that produces a 25ÂµW reading","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9f737","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i2jj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1knb0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b8j","text":"Headfix the mouse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5nlnj","text":"The system is ready to record. Prior to starting a behavior session with any given mouse:","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"efsj4","text":"Gently clean the tips of the implanted mono fiberoptic cannula (Doric Lenses Inc., MFC_400/430-0.66_5mm_MF1.25_FLT) and the mono fiberoptic patchcord with a cotton tipped applicator soaked in 70% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"98et0","text":"Dry with an air can, then connect the cannula and the patchcord using a zirconia sleeve (Doric Lenses Inc., SLEEVE_ZR_1-BK).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kaia","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sla9","text":"Make sure the cannula and patchcord are firmly touching â if there is a gap in between, the recording performance will be low.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ff55r","text":"Switch the Synapse software into Record Mode, and turn on both the 415 and 465 LED drivers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0naa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqdvc","text":"You will be able to clearly see light at the tip of the patchcord, even through the zirconia sleeve, when the LED drivers are on and correctly working.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4r0v5","text":"Run the behavior session (see Behavior protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eog07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mdqd","text":"Start the fiber photometry recording before starting behavior, and end it after behavior is done, so that the entire behavior session time is collected as fiber photometry time points","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fn6pa","text":"Once the behavior session is complete, end the recording by returning the software to Idle Mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: On every day of behavior (see Behavior protocol):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"frlrc","text":"Remove the patchcord and zirconia sleeve connector from the mouseâs cannula, and return the mouse to its home cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
